result.execSummary:
The defendant Brian Guzman was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia [Modifiers: Repeater], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Brian Guzman

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: $516.00 due in 30 days or 11 days KCJ or 11 days work crew.  Credit for 4 days.

Minutes:  15CM1265/15TR12857/58/59.  Clerk/T. Lehman.  ADA Krejcarek appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in person w/Atty John Arnold.  Cases are resolved.  

15CM1265 - deft pleads guilty; found guilty by the Court.  Admits to repeater.  Sentencing arguments made.  Deft fined $50 plus costs.  30 DTP.  In default, 11 days work crew or 11 days KCJ.  DNA ordered; notice given to deft.  Credit for 4 days.

15TR12857 - deft pleads guilty; found guilty by the Court.  Deft fined $150 plus costs.  30 DTP.  In default, 16 days work crew or 16 days KCJ.  Alcohol assessment ordered.  DL revoked for 6mos.  

15TR12858/59 - both cases are dismissed on State's motion per plea agreement.

Amended List and  Demand for Discovery
Submitted by ADA Jessica krejcarek

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lehman.  ADA Krejcarek appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in person w/Atty John Cabranes.  Atty Cabranes reports he received add'l discovery this morning from the State.  JS to remain on for 11/23/15 @ 9am.  Parties will have until 5pm on 11/18/15 to settle the case.  TR files to trail
No disposition. Leave on for next scheduled court activity.

1:29 pm  Spec Prosc Dan Tombasco appeared for the State.    Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Kristyne Watson.  Clerk:  JT.  Plea of not guilty entered.  Deft demands jury trial.  PTC 10-9-15 @ 2:10 & FPT 11-4-15 @ 10:20 & JS 11-23-15 @ 9:00 am.  PO Hold  $2500 signature bond set with conditions.

*Not to Possess or Consume Alcohol.  *Not To Possess or Consume Controlled Substances w/o a Prescription.  *Not to drive w/o VALID Driver's License.
961.573(1) - Poss of drug paraphernalia / Repeater
Demand for Discovery filed by ADA Delgado
and witness list filed by the State
